ShipDef

Class for a description of a type of ship.

Attributes
name

The name of the ship type

Availability

alpha 10

Status

stable

angularThrust

The amount of angular thrust this ship can achieve. This is the value responsible for the rate that the ship can turn at.

Availability

alpha 10

Status

experimental

capacity

The maximum space available for cargo and equipment, in tonnes

Availability

alpha 10

Status

experimental

hullMass

The total mass of the ship's hull, independent of any equipment or cargo inside it, in tonnes. This is the value used when calculating hyperjump ranges and hull damage.

Availability

alpha 10

Status

experimental

basePrice

The base price of the ship. This typically receives some adjustment before being used as a buy or sell price (eg based on supply or demand)

Availability

alpha 10

Status

experimental

minCrew

Minimum number of crew required to launch.

Availability

alpha 30

Status

experimental

maxCrew

Maximum number of crew the ship can carry.

Availability

alpha 30

Status

experimental

hyperdriveClass

An integer representing the power of the hyperdrive usually installed on those ships. If zero, it means the ship usually isn't equipped with one, although this does not necessarily mean one cannot be installed.

Availability

April 2014

Status

experimental

linearThrust

Table keyed on Constants.ShipTypeThruster, containing linear thrust of that thruster in newtons

Availability

alpha 32

Status

experimental

effectiveExhaustVelocity

Ship thruster efficiency as the effective exhaust velocity in m/s.  See http://​en​.wikipedia​.org​/wiki​/Specific_impulse for an explanation of this value.

Availability

November 2013

Status

experimental

thrusterFuelUse

Ship thruster efficiency as a percentage-of-tank-used per second of thrust.

Availability

November 2013

Status

experimental

equipSlotCapacity

Table keyed on <Constants.EquipSlot>, containing maximum number of items that can be held in that slot (ignoring mass)

Availability

alpha 32

Status

experimental

shipClass

Class of the ship (e.g. "medium_courier").

Status

experimental

manufacturer

Manufacturer of the ship (e.g. "kaluri").

Status

experimental

modelName

Name for the model of this ship. Important for looking up the actual ship model (Engine.GetModel(ShipDef.modelName)).

Status

experimental
